cscie160.hw7.atm

Class ATMImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • cscie160.hw7.atm.ATMImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ATM, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ATMImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ATM
    Implementation of the ATM's server-side backend.
    Author:
    Andy Kovtun
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ATMImpl(BankIntf bank)
      Instantiates a new object and associates a newly created collection of objects to it.
      Per assignment, 3 accounts are created with initial amount of $0, $100, $500.

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(int accountNumber,
                java.lang.String PIN)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: ATM
        Authenticate account with given number against the given PIN. If successful, store its number in session so that client does not need to resubmit the PIN for each transaction.
        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface ATM
        Throws:
        ATMException - If session not started or authentication fails
        java.rmi.RemoteException - For generic RMI errors

      • addListener

        private void addListener(ATMListener listener)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Register an ATM listener
        Parameters:
        listener - null means "don't register" (useful for silent tests)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • notifyListeners

        private void notifyListeners(java.lang.String message)
        Iterate through all registered listeners and send a TransactionNotification encapsulating this object's ID and the provided message.
        Would not fail if a RemoteException occurs during any individual listener's call.
        Parameters:
        message - Localized message

      • pingListeners

        private void pingListeners()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Invoke ATMListener.ping() for each listener to determine if RMI connection was dropped unexpectedly (without proper cleanup).
        Would fail upon indicating at least one dropped connection.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If any of listeners throws RemoteException indicating TCP connection drop.

      • checkAccess

        private void checkAccess(int accountNumber,
               OperationType type)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Check if the given account has access to perform a given kind of operation.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber -
        type -
        Throws:
        ATMException - If account is not authenticated in session or known to have no permission for a given operation.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - For generic RMI errors

      • checkSesionRunning

        private void checkSesionRunning()
                         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Assert on "session running" state.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If ATM session is not properly initialized

      • checkTimeout

        private void checkTimeout()
        Check if the session was inactive for a certain time. If so, give out a warning via client listener; if the warning was already issued before, force session shutdown.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • resetModel

        public void resetModel()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Debug time API only, not for release: reset model (restore ATM and accounts states to initial)
        Specified by:
        resetModel in interface ATM
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
